channel.title: Increasing the size of a VMWare Disk
channel.description: I am currently playing with SP1 of VSTS 2008 and TFS 2008 in a Windows Server 2008 VMWare instance I have. Whenever I created this particular instance I kept the disk space at 16Gb which is normally plenty for these...
channel.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by Justin Bakby+00:00
item.description:
Nice.
You use to have to use the VMKFSTOOLS on ESX to expand or shrink a VMFS volume.
e.g. vmkfstools -x 20g ./mydisk.vmdk would expand the vmdk to 20G then use window tools or partition magic.
item.dc:creator: Justin Bakby
